content: अपराजित {%<ab>a.</ab>%} Unconquered, invincible, unsurpassed; °ता दिक् the north-east direction, so called because the Gods were not defeated there; त (देवासुराः) उदीच्यां प्राच्यां दिश्ययतंत ते ततो न पराजयंत सैषा दिगपराजिता <ls>Ait. Br.</ls>, <ls>Ms. 6. 31.</ls> --तः {@--1@} A sort of poisonous insect. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu; of Śiva. {@--3@} One of the 11 Rudras. {@--4@} A class of divinities forming a portion of the अनुत्तर divinities of the Jainas. {@--5@} <ab>N.</ab> of a sage. --ता {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of Durgā, to be worshipped on the Vijayādaśamī or {%Daśarā%} day; दशम्यां च नरैः सम्यक् पूजनीयाऽपराजिता .… ददाति विजयं देवी पूजिता जयवर्धिनी <ls>Skanda P.</ls> {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of several plants; दूर्वा, शेफालिका, जयंती, असन, शंखिनी, हपुषा, असनपणीं. {@--3@} A kind of plant (or ओषधि) fastened round the wrist and serving as a charm or amulet; see <ls>Ś. 7.</ls> (In Vikramorvaśī Act 2, Kālidāsa uses अपराजिता in the sense of a spell or विद्या; ननु भगवता देवगुरुणा अपराजितां नाम शिखाबंधनविद्यामुपदिशता त्रिदशपरिपक्षस्यालंघनीये कृते स्वः). {@--4@} The north-east quarter; see under °त above. {@--5@} A kind of metre of {4} lines with 14 syllables in each. {@--6@} A sort of Yoginī.
